comment: Amazing lecturer, really cool guy and can be a little sarcastic which I thought was funny. There are very few grades in this class so tests are worth a lot. Gives many extra credit opportunities and tests align well with what is taught in lecture. Attendance not mandatory but I would definitely recommend going.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Mr. Hill was really nice and very generous when it came to grading. If you do the practice quizzes the day before the test you get extra credit. As long as you take notes in class/from the slides he posts and actually study them, you should be fine. Doing the Prex labs are super easy. In my opinion you can't fail this class unless you put 0 effort.

4 tests, 1 partner opinion activity, 1 (3 hrs) PREX research activity(s). There are 6 TOTAL grades in the class. Attendance is not checked and he states is not mandatory. Everything on the tests are in the powerpoints, which are all gone over in lectures throughout the semester. All tests are 50 questions via scantron. All quizzes solely for bonus.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: I would totally recommend Professor Hill for psychology. He is so funny and blunt, but it comes off in a very caring way. He respects everyone and makes class very interesting because he is so knowledgable. Only grades are two small assignments and 4 tests. Tests are only hard if you do not study. He gives great opportunities for extra credit.

Absolute king. Would take again, he tells you what to focus on for each exam, and if you study those, you are all set. He gives 5 bonus points on the exam if you get a 50% or higher on the quiz. Grades only on exams and one research paper (it's easy) If you pay attention and study, you're good. I

Tests are really difficult and require application of knowledge, not just learning terms and whatnot. He does curve though which is nice. Textbook is totally NOT available on reddit for free if you really want it, but it's not necessary imo. Lectures get occasionally boring but he posts all his slideshows on d2l. Attendance optional

Dr. Hill is very professional, and very good at explaining complex things, but still sometimes things get boring due to heavy lectures. But he is also funny and nice. I recommend that just do all the reading on time and you will be good, I did not do any reading which is why I got a 76% grade. But he also gives many extra credit opportunities.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy

comment: I thoroughly enjoyed this class! Dr. Hill gives amazing lectures that are informational and entertaining. He is very funny. Highly recommend.

Great professor, he really wants the best for his students. His lectures are not mandatory, but he includes examples from them in the exams. Final grade consists of 4 exams, a project, and a paper. Tests are difficult, but the study guides are very helpful. the quizzes are not graded, they are just a good way to study and get extra credit points.

He is a good professor but the test tend to be hard and require lockdown browser. the quizzes are not for a grade but are recommended because they prep you for the test. 4 test and one controversial paper with an interview. it does not feel like an intro class at all. you need to study hard and learn how to apply everything you learned.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Test heavy

comment: I love Professor Hill. It's an easy A if you read the textbook & study his slides. There are only 4 exams, which he will give you extra credit (up to 5 ppts) per exam if you get a 51% or higher on his practice quizzes on the first attempt. End of semester group project extra credit +15 points on lowest exam grade. You need to read the textbook.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--Group projects

comment: Great prof, very clear about what he is looking for, no tricky shenanigans. Great lectures, comes up with perfect examples, really knows his stuff. Open space for discussion, and brings up great topics and POV. Strict but fair teacher, gives extra credit from the quizzes. 4 exams that are not cumulative. Attend class and you will do well. Take him.

Amazing, entertaining lectures; welcoming of questions/discussion. Brought up related current events and engaged students in discussion. Understanding of students. Only 4 tests (4th test is "final", but not comprehensive). Quizzes are extra credit + offers additional extra credit. Textbook not used much, but attending lectures makes big difference

Incredible teacher! Engaging lectures that cover everything you need for the tests. All tests were online and open book. A really good mix of material and fun. Psych is not my major but this class made me consider switching, it's that good.

There were only 4 tests and the quizzes only counted for extra credit. His teaching style is mostly just reading the PowerPoints. Even though I studied for the tests, I failed almost all of them. I personally learned more from the textbook than from him. Would not take him again.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: I failed the first test but was still able to pass the class with a B. Quizzes only count as bonus points so you only have to focus on the tests and sona credits. The lectures were just read from power points so you really dont have to go to class.  Professor Hill was funny and interacts with the class unlike most professors i had
rating_tags: Hilarious--Graded by few things--Get ready to read

comment: Psychology is definitely a hard class to take. If you do not do well on one exam, then it will drop your grade and make it hard to possibly get an A in this class. As an individual aspiring to get into the nursing program and studying weeks before this exam like crazy, I would not recommend this class. You could spend a long time studying and fail.

The teacher himself is a nice guy, and he knows what he's teaching, but your grade is made up of 4 tests and Sona, and if you fail one test you're screwed. His TA makes the tests and they're nothing based of what you learn in class. Most of the questions are off quizlet so you can't really study for the tests. Also he sucks at responding emails :/
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: His lectures are entertaining and real life useful; however the content isnt always on the exam. Only 4 exams and 1 SONA credit is your grade makeup. The exams are HEAVY on the book chapters. Too much content for single exams and often the exams were not on what we majorly went over/discussed. Hes very knowledgeable on psych but grades are not it
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Attendance doesn't matter. I stopped going to his lectures and just read the PowerPoints. You can really just teach yourself the information. He doesn't really do much during the lecture.
had four tests with lockdown and camera. socratic has all the questions. he offers quizzes before for extra credit and always curves. very easy class.

Prof Hill is very fun and quirky. His class isn't too difficult if you study the powerpoints he goes over in class, but those are long. He's very fun to listen to and makes the content easy to understand. However, he is not very good at responding to emails quickly, if he responds at all. Otherwise, he's great!

Dr. Hill is by far my favorite professor I have taken at KSU. His lectures may be heavy but they are always entertaining and very helpful to ensure you do well on the exam. Take good notes and read the textbook and you will pass. He also does group quizzes for extra credit. Not hard to pass but you have to work for your grade. Overall best class!

He breaks down everything really well. There is a lot of material to cover in the intro course, however, he did the best he could. You are only graded on tests, the syllabus, and SONA. He offers bonus points on all the tests, but you definitely should show up and read the book. Great choice for a professor!
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Amazing lectures

comment: LOVED Prof. Hill!!! Not only is he hilarious, his lectures are great, he doesn't give homework, and he is really intellegent and knows his stuff! His test are a little tricky cause its not just straight from the book, but if you read and take notes you'll pass. Highly, HIGHLY recommend him!
His lectures are super fun! Will give you extra credit quizzes towards the test. Loved him. Best professor Ive had by far at KSU.

The only things youre graded on are the three tests and a mini project. Easy to get a good grade as long as you study hard for the tests and go to class. He makes lectures interesting but the only bad thing is youre graded on so little
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Dr. Hill is so freaking funny. Attendance is not mandatory, but if you show up he gives you extra credit on your test, plus its easier to pass if you show up because he goes over some of the questions that will be on the test on review days. His class is very lecture heavy and there is very little homework.

four exams final included, extra credit quizzes, and attendance is extra credit. Does go through material quick if no questions are asked, but welcomes questions and is willing to provide explanations. Way more lenient than most instructors. If sensitive to opinions and different point of views then don't show up or avoid.

He gives amazing and interesting lectures. A class before your exam, he puts everybody into section groups for practice question for extra credit (if your groups win). However, you should be following up in your reading. The only extra credit he gives you is attendance, practice group questions, and a final exam assignment. No HW, just 4 exams
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I loved prof. Hill. He teaches from his powerpoints that are also posted online but go to class because you will earn bonus points on exams for attendance. The class consists of a few tests and thats it. All tests are multiple choice and scenario based but make sure you study. LOVED HIMMMM

As a person, he's funny and interesting but as a professor I didn't find him good. He speeds through everything and tries to one up his students on almost everything. He doesn't really seem to care at all if you do good or not. Be ready to read the textbook and do all the work on the side or you won't pass. If you don't LOVE psych, DONT take him
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things--Lecture heavy

comment: The class is easy if you know how to study really well and are willing to read the textbook. Attendance is not graded, but it definitely helps to attend class. His tests are lecture based. The only grades are the 4 tests and a lab, so it is important to do well on those. Also, he never gives hw.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: My favorite professor so far. The class was easy and I learned a lot.

There are only 4 tests in this class (no other assignments) so they are weighted pretty heavy. If you know how to study you can get a B on the tests but the class has a lot of material so for me an A was hard to achieve. His lectures were great though and he was very knowledgable. He is a forensic psychologist and uses a lot of real world examples.
rating_tags: GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Amazing lectures--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Really awesome professor!!! He's super knowledgable about psychology and passionate about it. He's a really funny and cool guy so he makes lectures super interesting. Attendance isn't mandatory, but lectures are informative and hilarious. 4 multiple choice tests, and gives extra credit opportunities. Take him!!! He made me really enjoy psychology.
Not a psych major but I really enjoyed having him as a professor this semester. Very funny, would recommend you find the PDF of the book online and read it for the exams.

Hill is a great professor, he is very knowledgable of the subject. The class isn't easy but he will do his best to help. if you read the book and study the notes you can do well in the class. interesting class
rating_tags: Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Great teacher. Just show up to the lectures and pay attention - it's not hard because Psych is an interesting subject anyway. There is extra credit quizzes before the test, and he usually just bumps your test grade either way. Vert sarcastic and funny. Simple class. Just study your notes and the chapters to pass the tests and you'll be fine.

Attendance isn't mandatory, but it helps SO much to go. He gives you chances for extra credit throughout the semester. Definitely get the textbook for the class and you'll be fine. You won't do well on the tests if you don't read the book. Also helps to know vocabulary!

This man is fantastic, to say the least. Hes an experienced forensic psychologist, so he really backs up his lecture concepts with real life situations hes been in. Hes funny and really does like to engage the students. His tests are a little difficult, but we some amount of effort, youll be fine. I recommend him if you enjoy lively lectures.

All his tests are 100% based off the textbook so really theres no point in going to class. However, hes a really interesting guy to listen to and has great real life examples. Grades include only 4 tests and the easy SONA points. Show up to the class before the test because he does group quizzes which are worth extra credit points!!!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: I loved taking this class. Lectures aren't too hard to sit through because he makes them interesting and interacts with the class. Grade is made up of 4 tests and a SONA project. The SONA project is ridiculously easy the tests however are not but if you study and use your book you should be fine. Zero hw assignments. 100% would take again.

Dr. Hill is HILARIOUS!! He really cares about his subject and he relates his field work to his class, which is interesting. However, I am not a psych major and this is an entry level class, and it was so hard! The tests are super difficult with lots of information on them. Funny guy, but I wouldn't recommend unless you're a psych/sociology major.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: I'm not a psyc. major so I just took this class as an elective. The class was really interesting! Professor Hill is really funny & he would also tell us about cases he's done which was cool. The tests were tough just because there was a lot of information to remember, but I got B's on all of them just by going over the powerpoints. Would take again

Class is 88.8% test and then extra "gimme" points. There are 4 multiple-choice tests and curves all of them, plus showing up to class can award you extra credit. Non-mandatory quizzes on the class before tests that can get you extra credit. Studied w/ flashcards,made A's on  tests except the one where I skipped a week of class. Take him to learn.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--TEST HEAVY--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: He is very funny and know what he teaches, but this is literally the toughest class I have ever taken and this is just an INTRO CLASS! There are only 4 tests  and the final (test 4) is non cumulative (YAAS). Gives extra credit before tests (max 9 points) and curves the tests. He has power points up, but you'll need to definitely read the textbook!

Intro to Psyc has a lot of information that you need to know. Dr. Hill as a human being is hilarious, fun, and an interesting person. As a teacher, he does a good job at going over everything, yet he goes really fast so print the notes and write little notes on the side. READ THE BOOK! it is the only way to pass. his test are ridiculously hard

Dr. Hill is a great teacher. He is very sarcastic (in a funny/good way). He makes his lectures interesting with examples of his personal experiences with patients. His tests are not easy but they are bearable with some effort. He also gives several extra credit opportunities to help you out each test. Study his powerpoints and you will be fine.

you have to put in work to make an A in his class which means read EVERY chapter that he tells you the tests will be on. He loves class participation and class discussions. also if you strictly read the power points in preparation for the exams you will do poorly. Read the textbook AND the power points and you can make an A. overall great guy!!
Great guy, great class, very knowledgeable. He won't just hand you the A, but he won't make it overwhelming either. Would take again.
simply amazing.

He knows what he's talking about, since he is a clinical psychologist.  His lectures are detailed, but you learn a lot of cool stuff.  He likes Smash Bros. Attendance isn't mandatory but it definitely helps.

Professor Hill is honestly a very knowledgable professor. He knows what he is talking about and adds stories from his own experience as a psychologist. His tests are very tough. You NEED to read the book if you want to pass. I honestly enjoyed going to his class and listening.

He was a great professor overall! He gives a ton of extra credit opportunities. Classes are long though, as he reads straight from the slides and doesn't really explain more (except for a few stories). I would recommend buying the study guide book, rather than the textbook. It was a lot more helpful, and you will definitely need it.

Dr. Hill is by far my favorite professor I've had in college. He is young, funny, and extremely intelligent. His tests are somewhat difficult, so be prepared to study, but he does give extra credit. I recommend Dr. Hill constantly.

Doctor Hill made me fall in love with psychology. He clearly loves talking about all things psych and finds ways to spice up his lectures through personal stories and in class activities. His tests are a little rough but if you study and read the book like he says an A is easy to achieve. Also, show up to class for extra credit opportunities.

Although I got a C in his class, he is worth rating because he was hilarious. He has a great sense of humor and would make the whole class laugh a lot with his funny stories. I loved him. The tests were difficult for me at first, probably because I didn't read the book. But I bought the study guide book and that helped me pass my tests.

Gives great lectures. The way he'll interact with you will make them feel more like a conversation instead of just watching him ramble for an hour. Just take a couple hours to go over his powerpoints the night before his tests and you should ace them. The SONA research project may sound scary but all it is is answering questions for short surveys.

Be prepared to read the book. The tests are not difficult if you read and pay attention. He relates some points of the lecture to his job and it is really interesting. He can also be pretty funny at times.

He is one of the best professors to take. The class is relatively easy, just read and pay attention to his lectures. Also, he is pretty funny and he gives real life examples from his job. Definitely recommend.

Prof. Hill was great. I HATE psych and usually only studied the night before and day of the test and made As and Bs. Study the power points and make flash cards and you'll be fine. The lecture before the test he sits down with the test in his hands and let's you ask what is and isn't on the test, to narrow down studying. No projects. Go to class

This course covers a lot, but he manages to cover everything and make it interesting. He also uses his own work stories for examples in class. There are 4 test, and extra credit quizzes at the end of each chapter. His powerpoints are all online and he will tell you the class before what will be on the test.

Dr. Hill was a great professor. He was clear and he got to the point during his lectures. He relates a lot of his material to real life scenarios. He is highly intellectual, and everything I learned was extremely interesting. I would take him again in a heartbeat.

AWESOME. By far one of my most interesting professors thus far. Come to class and do the assignments. Join study groups if you have the opportunity. Dr. Hill will attend if available and will help you narrow down your field of study. Dr. Hill my music buddy!

He's a great professor. He's young so is pretty laid back, your choice to come to class or not, easy to get extra credit in here. Lectures can sometimes be long but he'll relate stuff to experiences and other interesting cases. Tests can be a bit difficult, use ppts and book, take good notes. Got a c bc I opened the textbook maybe once or twice

Mr. Hill is AMAZING & he's adorable! Psych is a hard class period, but he related the material through his experiences and your everyday life! READ THE BOOK & PPTs! Reading is fundamental for this class! Overall great professor. I LOVE HIM!

I am confused by the other rater because Dr. Hill definitely my most interesting prof. His class is my favorite. He is very funny and compassionate with students. It is tough material so the tests are hard. He has a lot of extra credit opportunities and doesn't assign papers or presentations. I like his stories and relaxed attitude.

This class was by far my lowest grade yet. He uses a premade PowerPoint which he reads WORD FOR WORD. He talks about his clinical experiences which are a nice break from the ppts. and slips curse words sometimes which make him funnier. He seems cross when he's lecturing but he's super nice when you talk to him. The book is a must, read everything
